name: nomad
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing nomad cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`nomad` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-nomad).

address.description: URL of the root of the target Nomad agent.

caFile.description: A path to a PEM-encoded certificate authority used to verify the remote agent's certificate.

caPem.description: PEM-encoded certificate authority used to verify the remote agent's certificate.

certFile.description: A path to a PEM-encoded certificate provided to the remote agent; requires use of key_file or key_pem.

certPem.description: PEM-encoded certificate provided to the remote agent; requires use of key_file or key_pem.

consulToken.description: Consul token to validate Consul Connect Service Identity policies specified in the job file.

headers.description: The headers to send with each Nomad request.

keyFile.description: A path to a PEM-encoded private key, required if cert_file or cert_pem is specified.

keyPem.description: PEM-encoded private key, required if cert_file or cert_pem is specified.

region.description: Region of the target Nomad agent.

secretId.description: ACL token secret for API requests.

vaultToken.description: Vault token if policies are specified in the job file.

allowFs.description:
`(boolean: false)` - Set this to `true` to be able to use
HCL2 filesystem functions

enabled.description:
`(boolean: false)` - Set this to `true` if your jobspec uses the HCL2
format instead of the default HCL.

region.description: `(string: <required>)` - The region these limits should apply to.

regionLimit.description:
`(block: <required>)` - The limits to enforce. This block
may only be specified once in the `limits` block. Its structure is
documented below.

cpu.description:
`(int: 0)` - The amount of CPU to limit allocations to. A value of zero
is treated as unlimited, and a negative value is treated as fully disallowed.

memoryMb.description:
`(int: 0)` - The amount of memory (in megabytes) to limit
allocations to. A value of zero is treated as unlimited, and a negative value
is treated as fully disallowed.

type.description: `(string)` - An optional string to filter scaling policies based on policy type. If not provided, policies of all types are returned.

provider.description:
The provider type for the nomad package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

vaultToken.description: Vault token if policies are specified in the job file.

name.description: `(string: <required>)` - A unique name for the policy.

rulesHcl.description:
`(string: <required>)` - The contents of the policy to register,
as HCL or JSON.

as HCL or JSON.

accessorId.description:
`(string)` - A non-sensitive identifier for this token that
can be logged and shared safely without granting any access to the cluster.

createTime.description: `(string)` - The timestamp the token was created.

global.description:
`(bool: false)` - Whether the token should be replicated to all
regions, or if it will only be used in the region it was created in.

name.description: `(string: "")` - A human-friendly name for this token.

policies.description:
`(set: [])` - A set of policy names to associate with this
token. Must be set on `client`-type tokens, must not be set on
`management`-type tokens. Policies do not need to exist before being
used here.

secretId.description:
`(string)` - The token value itself, which is presented for
access to the cluster.

type.description:
`(string: <required>)` - The type of token this is. Use `client`
for tokens that will have policies associated with them. Use `management`
for tokens that can perform any action.

global.description:
`(bool: false)` - Whether the token should be replicated to all
regions, or if it will only be used in the region it was created in.

name.description: `(string: "")` - A human-friendly name for this token.

policies.description:
`(set: [])` - A set of policy names to associate with this
token. Must be set on `client`-type tokens, must not be set on
`management`-type tokens. Policies do not need to exist before being
used here.

type.description:
`(string: <required>)` - The type of token this is. Use `client`
for tokens that will have policies associated with them. Use `management`
for tokens that can perform any action.

capabilities.description: Capabilities intended to be used in a job. At least one capability must be provided.

capacityMax.description: Defines how large the volume can be. The storage provider may return a volume that is smaller than this value.

capacityMin.description: Defines how small the volume can be. The storage provider may return a volume that is larger than this value.

cloneId.description: The volume ID to clone when creating this volume. Storage provider must support cloning. Conflicts with 'snapshot_id'.

mountOptions.description: Options for mounting 'block-device' volumes without a pre-formatted file system.

name.description: The display name of the volume.

namespace.description: The namespace in which to create the volume.

parameters.description: An optional key-value map of strings passed directly to the CSI plugin to configure the volume.

pluginId.description: The ID of the CSI plugin that manages this volume.

secrets.description: An optional key-value map of strings used as credentials for publishing and unpublishing volumes.

snapshotId.description:
The snapshot ID to restore when creating this volume. Storage provider must support snapshots. Conflicts with
'clone_id'.

type.description: The type of the volume. Currently, only 'csi' is supported.

volumeId.description: The unique ID of the volume, how jobs will refer to the volume.

allocationIds.description: The IDs for allocations associated with this job.

datacenters.description: The target datacenters for the job, as derived from the jobspec.

deploymentId.description: If detach = false, the ID for the deployment associated with the last job create/update, if one exists.

deploymentStatus.description: If detach = false, the status for the deployment associated with the last job create/update, if one exists.

deregisterOnDestroy.description: If true, the job will be deregistered on destroy.

deregisterOnIdChange.description:
`(boolean: true)` - Determines if the job will be
deregistered if the ID of the job in the jobspec changes.

detach.description:
`(boolean: true)` - If true, the provider will return immediately
after creating or updating, instead of monitoring.

hcl2.description: `(block: optional)` - Options for the HCL2 jobspec parser.

jobspec.description: `(string: <required>)` - The contents of the jobspec to register.

json.description:
`(boolean: false)` - Set this to `true` if your jobspec is structured with
JSON instead of the default HCL.

modifyIndex.description: Integer that increments for each change. Used to detect any changes between plan and apply.

name.description: The name of the job, as derived from the jobspec.

namespace.description: The namespace of the job, as derived from the jobspec.

policyOverride.description:
`(boolean: false)` - Determines if the job will override any
soft-mandatory Sentinel policies and register even if they fail.

purgeOnDestroy.description:
`(boolean: false)` - Set this to true if you want the job to
be purged when the resource is destroyed.

region.description: The target region for the job, as derived from the jobspec.

type.description: The type of the job, as derived from the jobspec.

deregisterOnDestroy.description: If true, the job will be deregistered on destroy.

deregisterOnIdChange.description:
`(boolean: true)` - Determines if the job will be
deregistered if the ID of the job in the jobspec changes.

detach.description:
`(boolean: true)` - If true, the provider will return immediately
after creating or updating, instead of monitoring.

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing nomad cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-nomad)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-nomad` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-nomad/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`hashicorp/terraform-provider-nomad` repo](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-nomad/issues).

> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-nomad)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-nomad` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-nomad/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`hashicorp/terraform-provider-nomad` repo](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-nomad/issues).
